page.title: 15PETS KEPT BY CORBY FAMILIES.
page.content: No pets at all: 13% of all households. Pet owners: no correlation between pets kept and the number of children in the house. The dog was the most popular animal. 1-child homes: 1.Dogs(26%) 2.Goldfish 2-child homes: 1.Dogs(19%) 2.Rabbits 3-child homes: 1.Dogs(39%) 2.Cats 64% of all pets were kept because their owners liked them. Some dogs were kept for security and protection. Costs per week were: Dogs #4.30, Cats #3, rabbits only #1.50 to keep (food mainly). Dog licence cost 37p for one year. All pets were given special pet foods. Additionally, 31% ate scraps and 7% of dogs had fresh meat. Pets were fed twice daily; young pets more often.
